question:
Characteristic of venous blood flow of lower limb in duplex Doppler is?
A. Monophasic
B. Biphasic
C. Triphasic
D. Non phasic

Intensifying screen is used in extraoral radiograph to:
A. Decrease radiation to patient
B. Increase contrast
C. Decrease contrast
D. Collimation

Empty Thecal sac sign in:
A. Arachnoiditis
B. Tethered Cord syndrome
C. Veebral osteomyelitis
D. Discitis

Yellowish-brown staining of the IOPA dental X-ray film is due to:
A. Immersion in fixer without washing
B. Increased temperature of developer
C. Increased exposure time
D. Drying away of the developer solution
answer: A. Immersion in fixer without washing

question:
Consistent radiographs require:
A. Long cone technique
B. Fixed kvp & mA
C. Automatic processing
D. Proper developing

Patient's cross-infection with sensor, in digital radiography/RVG is prevented by
A. Cover with autoclaved cloth with each use
B. Wipe with ethyl alcohol in each patient
C. Clean with 5.25% sodium hypochlorite in each patient
D. Cover with impervious barrier

A 8 year old child presented with cough and fever since 15 days. On auscultation, decreased air entry was found on right side. A CXR was done and shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A. Consolidation
B. Abscess
C. Hydatid Cyst
D. Congenital. AV Malformation

26 year old, 6 feet 4 inch male presented to the emergency depament with complaints of acute onset dysnea. On examination, he was tachypneic, other vitals were stable. A chest xray was done which shown the following pathology:
A. Pneumothorax
B. Hydropnemo thorax
C. Massive pleural effusion
D. Pulmonary embolism

Which of the following is the least useful for diagnosis of Spondylolisthesis?
A. CT
B. MR
C. X-ray lumbar spine- AP view
D. X-ray lumbar spine- Lateral view
answer: C. X-ray lumbar spine- AP view

question:
The skin of a patient undergoing radiotherapy will show
after 2 weeks?
A. Erythema
B. Depigmentation
C. Radiation induced carcinomas
D. No change

Which of these is not a pa of catatonia?
A. Akathisia
B. Ambivalence
C. Ambitendency
D. Akinesia

Radiation causes cell death by:
A. Charring of nucleoproteins
B. Destroying their mitochondria
C. Ionization
D. Disruption of cytosol

The principal reason for placing an aluminium filter in
the primary beam of radiation is to:
A. Reduce exposure time
B. Decrease development time of the films
C. Reduce radiation to the skin of the patient
D. Obtain greater definition of the images of teeth
answer: C. Reduce radiation to the skin of the patient

question:
Disadvantages of grids are:
A. Skin exposure of patient
B. Increase exposure time
C. Doesn't improve image
D. Overall density of radiograph is increased

Which film is used for caries detection? (or) Which film
is used for caries detection in children?
A. D speed
B. E speed
C. B speed
D. F speed

The base of an X-ray film is composed of:
A. Polyester
B. Gelatin
C. Nylon
D. Bromide

Patient with history of tachyarrhythmias is on implantable cardioveer defibrillator. He develops shock. Best method to know the position and integrity of ICD is:
A. CECT
B. MRI
C. USG
D. Plain radiograph

The single most effective method of reducing patient
somatic exposure when taking radiograph is to use:
A. A lead apron
B. Speed E film
C. Added filtration
D. An open ended, shielded cone

If multiple myeloma is suspected in a patient's history and intraoral radiograph, which of the following radiographs should be taken to confirm the diagnosis?
A. Lateral skull
B. Anterior posterior view
C. Lateral oblique
D. Posterior anterior view

Campbell's lines are seen in:
A. Transorbital
B. Transpharyngeal
C. Occipitomental
D. Transcranial

Radiographs are of no help in the diagnosis of
A. Cementoma
B. Subluxation teeth
C. Acute alveolar abscess
D. Impacted canines

Which of the following has a radiolucency closest to the dentin:
A. ZOE
B. Calcium hydroxide
C. Silicophosphate
D. Gutta percha

Cementosis are commonly seen in:
A. Females in maxilla
B. Females in mandible
C. Males in maxilla
D. Males in mandible

What is the most poable diagnosis based on the findings in the CT scan given below?
A. Extradural hemorrhage
B. Subdural hamorrhage
C. Intracerebral hamorrhage
D. Subarachnoid hamorrhage

A patient who has been given tumoricidal dose of radiotherapy recently reports to dental clinic with painful carious exposed mandibular first molar with periapical abscess. The treatment of choice should be:
A. Extraction of the offending tooth
B. Root canal treatment if possible
C. No treatment should be given
D. Incision and drainage of abscess
answer: B. Root canal treatment if possible

question:
A patient with pain abdomen for 2 hours presents to the casualty and the following X-ray was obtained. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A. Pneumoperitoneum
B. Subphrenic abscess
C. Pneumomediastinum
D. Amebic liver abscess

Which of the following statements about developing a dental radiograph is false?
A. It involves chemically precipitating metallic silver
B. If it is too long, it results in an over dark radiograph
C. If high temperatures are used, it results in a fogged, over dark radiograph
D. It typically involves a developer containing sodium thiosulphate
answer: D. It typically involves a developer containing sodium thiosulphate

question:
Reversal lines are characteristic on the radiograph of:
A. Osteoma
B. Osteosarcoma
C. Epidermoid cyst
D. Paget's disease of bone

The darkening of radiograph X-ray depends on all except:
A. Thickness of object
B. Quality and quantity of X-rays
C. Angulation cone
D. Velocity of electron emitted from cathode

Effect of radiation is:
A. Cumulative
B. Fractionalized
C. Concentrated
D. Dependent on genetic make-up of individuals

In leukemia patient, post extraction bleeding doesn't stop because of:
A. Increased leukocyte count
B. Increased Ca+ level in blood
C. Platelet disorder
D. Deficiency of clotting factors

The radiopacity that frequently obliterate the root apices of maxillary molars is
A. Maxillary sinus
B. Palatine bone
C. Zygoma and Zygomatic process of Maxilla
D. Orbital process of Zygomatic bone
answer: C. Zygoma and Zygomatic process of Maxilla

question:
Disadvantages of using a GRID during radiography is:
A. Increased patient exposure due to more exposure time
B. Decreased exposure time
C. Increased secondary radiation fog to film
D. Reduces secondary radiation to film
answer: A. Increased patient exposure due to more exposure time

question:
Radiation effect blood supply because of
A. Anemia
B. Endarteritis of small blood vessels
C. Infection
D. All of the above
answer: B. Endarteritis of small blood vessels

question:
Dead bone appears on a radiograph as:
A. Radiolucent
B. Radio-opaque
C. Cotton wool appearance
D. Salt and pepper appearance

Which of the following resembles caries in radiographs?
A. Zinc oxide eugenol
B. Zinc phosphate
C. GIC
D. Polymethyl methacnilate

Decay of enamel following radiotherapy is initiated due to:
A. Decrease in salivary flow
B. Direct radiations contacting the enamel
C. Dessication of tooth structure
D. Hypocalcification and pitting of enamel

The bisecting angle technique is used to take
A. Bitewing radiographs
B. Periapical radiographs
C. True occlusal radiographs of the mandible
D. None of the above

Radiolucencies of the jaw may be seen in:
A. Multiple myeloma
B. Giant cell tumours
C. Hyperparathyroidism
D. All of the above

In intraoral radiograph, patient radiation is decreased by
all except:
A. High speed film
B. Intensifying screens
C. Lead apron
D. Decreasing kVp

For maintaining parallelism between object the and
film, film is placed at a distance to avoid distortion what should be done:
A. Increase target to object distance
B. Decrease target to object distance
C. Both of the above
D. None of the above
answer: A. Increase target to object distance

question:
What is the function of filtration process while taking radiographs?
A. Remove the short wavelength photons
B. Remove the portion of long wavelength photons
C. To increase the radiation dose to patient
D. To increase scatter of secondary radiation
answer: B. Remove the portion of long wavelength photons

question:
In cephalometric radiography, the distance between the subject and the source of X-ray is
A. 2 feet
B. 48 inches
C. 4.8 metres
D. 5 feet

There is <2 cm painful swelling responsive to salicylates, this is:
A. Osteoma
B. Osteochondroma
C. Osteoid osteoma
D. Osteoblastoma

The best radiographic view of temporomandibular joint
is given by:
A. Transorbital view
B. Reverse Towne's view
C. Transpharyngeal
D. Panorex

To localize a supernumerary or an impacted tooth and
determine its exact relationship to the other teeth, which of the following radiographs would be most effective?
A. A periapical and an occlusal view
B. An occlusal view using a high angle
C. A panoramic radiograph
D. Two or more periapical views at different angles and an occlusal view
answer: D. Two or more periapical views at different angles and an occlusal view

question:
Patient's cross infection with bite block of orthopantamograph machine is prevented by
A. Cover with autoclaved cloth with each use
B. Using disposable bite blocks
C. Clean with 5.25% sodium hypochlorite in each patient
D. Cover with impervious barrier

Radio density can be increased by
A. Decreasing MA
B. Decreasing kVp
C. Decreasing target film distance
D. Increasing target film distance

The maximum penetration among the following is seen with which ray:
A. Alpha
B. Beta
C. Gamma
D. Electron Beam

Which type of laser is used in waterlase system?
A. Argon laser
B. Diode Laser
C. Nd:YAG laser
D. YSGG Laser

Maximum recommended dose for dental X-ray operator in a week is
A. 100 milliroentgen
B. 10 roentgen
C. 100 roentgen
D. 300 roentgen

Density of radiograph is affected by all, except:
A. mA
B. kVp
C. Cone angulation
D. Thickness of object

Patient with carcinoma endometrium treated with pelvic external beam irradiation to whole pelvis. Which of the following organs is most radiosensitive in the pelvic region?
A. Ovary
B. Vagina
C. Bladder
D. Rectum

Occluded submandibular salivary duct can be best observed by
A. Palpation
B. Sialography
C. Occlusal X-ray
D. Thermography

Expansion of the contrast filled space in myelography is seen in:
A. Intramedullary tumor
B. Intradural extramedullary tumor
C. Spinal dysraphism
D. Extradural tumor

The speed with which the electrons travel from the
filament of cathode to the anode depends upon
A. Potential difference between the two electrodes
B. Number of milliamperes in the tube circuit
C. Angle between the filament and target
D. Voltage of the filament
answer: A. Potential difference between the two electrodes

question:
Which among the following is not a risk factor for contrast-induced nephropathy?
A. Diabetic nephropathy
B. High osmolar agent
C. Obesity
D. Dehydration

Which type of radiation effect results in radiation induced thyroid cancer?
A. Somatic
B. Genetic
C. Teratogenic
D. Autosomal

For a maxillary premolar in a radiograph, the facial root appears distal to the palatal root, the film was exposed with:
A. Increased vertical angulation
B. Decreased vertical angulation
C. From mesial side of the tooth
D. From distal side of the tooth
answer: C. From mesial side of the tooth

question:
All of the following statements about an intraoral dental
X-ray film are true except:
A. It is composed of a cellulose acetate base coated with a silver bromide emulsion
B. It has a thin sheet of lead foil that lies in front of the film to prevent overexposure
C. It has an embossed dot on it which should be orientated towards the source of X-rays
D. It is exposed by the direct action of X-rays on the emulsion
answer: B. It has a thin sheet of lead foil that lies in front of the film to prevent overexposure

question:
Investigation of choice for a lesion of the temporal bone is
A. X-ray
B. USG
C. CT
D. MRI

In an internal derangement of TMJ fracture, panoramic view has been taken for the patient. To confirm our diagnosis, we may take the help of
A. MRI
B. CT scan
C. Arthroscopy
D. Bone scan

A 10 year old presented to ohopaedic OPD with a Curved Back, AP and Lateral Radiographs are obtained, what is the most likely cause of such deformity?
A. Congenital
B. Neurofibromatosis
C. Idiopathic
D. Neuromuscular

Which of the following are most sensitive to X-ray?
A. Tooth buds and salivary glands
B. Nerve and muscle tissue
C. Hair and nails
D. Cartilage
answer: A. Tooth buds and salivary glands

question:
The best radiograph to obtain a view of maxillary sinus is:
A. Lateral oblique maxilla
B. Submentovertex
C. Waters view
D. Lateral skull

Best noninvasive investigation to check for bility of myocardium is:
A. FDG-18 PET CT
B. MIBG scintigraphy
C. Echocardiogram
D. Thallium scintigraphy

A middle aged female presents with slowly progressive weakness of lower limbs, spasticity and recent onset hesitancy of Micturition. On neurological examination there is evidence of dorsal myelopathy. MRI scan of spine reveals middorsal intradural contrast enhancing mass lesion. Diagnosis is:
A. Intradural lipoma
B. Dermoid cyst
C. Meningioma
D. Epidermoid cyst

The usual radiographic appearance of an osteosarcoma is:
A. Discrete radiolucency with regular borders
B. Multicystic radiolucency with a soap bubble appearance with an irregular peripheral border
C. Sunburst pattern with radiopaque strands extending from the cortical plates
D. Cotton wool appearance with an irregular peripheral border
answer: C. Sunburst pattern with radiopaque strands extending from the cortical plates

question:
All of the following form radiolucent stones except:
A. Xanthine
B. Cysteine
C. Allopurinol
D. Orotic acid
